head.title: IN BRIEF: Environment; FOR ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES ONLY

hedline.hl1: IN BRIEF: Environment; FOR ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES ONLY

abstract.p: Westchester County Executive Andrew Spano says separate court, part of New York State Supreme Court, is being set up with its own permanent judge and staff to hear environmental cases (S)

block.p: A separate court is being set up to hear environmental cases. The court will be a part of the State Supreme Court and will have a permanent judge and its own staff to concentrate on land-use and environmental issues. It is similar to other dedicated parts of State Supreme Court, which handle domestic violence, matrimonial and commercial issues. ''The key word here is expertise,'' County Executive Andrew J. Spano said. ''We want the judge and his or her staff to be immersed in environmental law.'' The court is expected to be operating by January.
